Name: JargonObstructionClassifier
Purpose: Identify which specific terms, labels, and metrics in investment apps act as comprehension barriers for young beginners and thus contribute to intimidation and disengagement.
Deliverables: A labeled vocabulary map that classifies each surfaced term/label/metric into categories: {core-concept, advanced-concept, ambiguous-label, unexplained-acronym, context-dependent term}; for each term, an estimated novice-comprehension level and an ‘intimidation likelihood’ score based on rule sets about prerequisite knowledge and contextual cues.
Strengths: Effective at pinpointing exactly which words, phrases, and metrics (e.g., P/E, beta, margin, options Greeks) are likely to be perceived as threatening or opaque; can reveal clusters of jargon that co-occur on screens and jointly increase intimidation.
Watch-out: Breaks down when asked to simplify or rewrite terms (it only classifies, it does not generate explanations); not suitable for UX layout decisions, emotional analysis, or portfolio recommendations; must avoid discussing risk profiling, asset allocation, or interface aesthetics and must not provide general educational content beyond tagging difficulty and intimidation likelihood.
